healthy.description: Uniform green leaves with no spots or discoloration, indicating healthy growth. Common in well-watered, nutrient-rich crops.

powdery_mildew.description: White powdery spots on leaves, often with a fuzzy texture, indicating a fungal infection (e.g., Erysiphe cichoracearum). Prevalent in humid conditions as of October 2025.

leaf_blight.description: Brown, dry, and cracked lesions on leaves, often with irregular edges, caused by bacterial (e.g., Xanthomonas) or fungal blight. Noted in dry seasons.

rust.description: Orange-brown rust spots with a rough texture, typically caused by rust fungi (e.g., Puccinia). Common in warm, wet climates in 2025.

yellowing.description: Yellowing leaves with a wilted appearance, often due to nutrient deficiency (e.g., nitrogen) or water stress. Observed in over-irrigated fields.

downy_mildew.description: Grayish-white fuzzy growth on the underside of leaves, caused by downy mildew fungi (e.g., Peronospora). Linked to cool, wet weather in October 2025.

anthracnose.description: Dark brown sunken spots with a water-soaked appearance, caused by Colletotrichum fungi. Common in rainy regions.

bacterial_spot.description: Black, water-soaked spots on leaves, caused by bacteria (e.g., Xanthomonas campestris). Often seen in warm, wet conditions.
